Description of incident: A flashdrive was discovered missing from an office on December 28, 2010. It and other items that did not contain patient personal information are presumed to have been stolen by a former employee who left at the end of December.  The former employee has an extensive criminal background and was arrested on February 9.  Authorities involved in the criminal investigation requested that notification of the breach be delayed due to the investigation.  The flash drive contained the personal and medical records of about 70,000 patients. Patient names, Social Security numbers, addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth and other information, including insurance information and medical information was exposed. As a result of the breach, The Family Planning Council will no longer allow unencrypted information to be stored on removable hardware.
